title: Views wanted on East Riding of Yorkshire Council boundary changes
title_page: Views wanted on East Riding of Yorkshire Council boundary changes - BBC News
maintext:
A public consultation has been launched into proposed changes to local election boundaries in East Yorkshire.
People have been invited to help shape new council wards for East Riding of Yorkshire Council.
A review by the Local Government Boundary Commission concluded the area needed 67 councillors representing 28 wards, rather than the current 26.
Prof Colin Mellors, the head of the commission, said: "We want to make sure these new electoral arrangements reflect communities. We also want them to be easy to understand and convenient for local people."
